intro: Eriophyllum biternatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf whitethorn, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and arranged in threes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriophyllum biternatum is also known for its ability to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in arid environments.
